1.text: Wash off the blade with a mild dish soap water to remove debris.

2.text: Mix 3 parts of baking soda with 1 part water in a bowl.

3.text: Spread the baking soda over the blade with a toothbrush.

4.text: Scrub the baking soda into rust spots with a toothbrush.

5.text: Brush the blade with super fine steel wool to eliminate older rust stains.

6.text: Rinse the knife under warm water to clean off the rust.

7.text: Wipe water off the blade with a clean microfiber cloth.

8.text: Fill a cup full of white vinegar.

9.text: Soak the blade in the vinegar for at least 5 minutes.

10.text: Wipe off the rust using a mildly abrasive scouring pad.

11.text: Rinse the blade under warm water to clear off the vinegar.

12.text: Wipe the blade dry with a clean microfiber cloth.

13.text: Scrub the blade with a sponge dampened in soapy water.

14.text: Spray WD-40 over the rust spots on the blade.

15.text: Wait 10 minutes for the WD-40 to soak into the blade.

16.text: Use 400-grit sandpaper to scrub rust off of the blade.

17.text: Treat the blade repeatedly with WD-40 if it’s still rusty.

18.text: Apply a fresh coat of WD-40 to protect the blade when you’re finished.
